Tucson turns on Leo and stomps a powerful foot down on the ground.  Somethi=
ng had just snapped inside his directory yet he still keeps his composure.
=

" It isn't a matter of what the Predacon has told me, it was a matter of h=
ow composed they remained while helping us.  Oh yes I kept that in the back=
 of my mind Leo Prime, I kept that in the back of my mind. "

He narrows hi=
s eyes with a wise expression.  

" I wondered why the alliance went as wel=
l as it did.  I was sure to get a refusal but I didn't, and at first I thou=
ght nothing of it but then I started thinking.  How could this be?  Oh yes =
for a grave price you get cooperation from a Predacon.  Now you tell me Leo=
, I'm listening, how is it that this alliance happened so easily?  I will t=
ake back what I said and things will be as they stand, with you in command =
of course.  The truth Leo, all I want   IS THE TRUTH.  You can tell me that=
 can you?"

He stands firm with a thrash of his tail.

Don't be envious of =
what you don't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is=
 worth more than family and friends.

On Dec 30, 2011, at 5:55 PM, Super Cy=
clonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > With great compo=
sure, yet with a serious air to his expression, Tucson
> > lowers his head =
to Leo Prime. Nothing out of his mouth, not even a growl.
> > Then he raise=
s his head somewhat with a reserved sigh.
> >
> > " To assure the alliance,=
 you promised the Predacons a maximal stasis pod.
> > Why was this not brou=
ght to my attention directly? And why did you agree
> > with this bargain w=
ithout my consent? I thought I could trust you, Leo but
> > it seems that l=
ike Rodimus, that air of trust simply isn't there. I'm not
> > at all pleas=
ed with what has come to my attention, and I demand that the
> > bargain be=
 revoked immediately. I also demand that you step down from
> > command unt=
il further notice. A life is not a mode of currency that can be
> > exchang=
ed for cooperation. We must earn that right with trust and the
> > promise =
to follow through with difficult challenges. Now as of this
> > moment, I r=
equest that Big Convoy assumes command beside me, since he has
> > truly ea=
rned my trust during this time. That's all I have to say, let's
> > finish =
what we started, without having to pay with a life that is not our
> > own.=
"
> >
> > All the while, his tone is kept soft but with a very heavy heart.=
 He turns
> > away from Leo, with his head lowered in disappointment.
> 
> =
<NEW>
> 
> LEO PRIME frowned, one that deepened as TUSCON talked.
> 
> Ther=
e was a frown from SANTON as well, but he carefully put his arm on
> LEO's =
shoulder as he could see the anger that was building in him as
> TUSCON tal=
ked.
> 
> In fact there were various blinks and looks of surprise from most=
 of
> the MAXIMALS present. Although PREDACONS like SKY SHADOW got a
> misc=
hievous look on his face as he heard the accusation, although
> CRYOTEK's w=
as more amused than anything else.
> 
> "What!?!?" LEO PRIME finally blurte=
d out, his word an explosive sound.
> "You relieve me of what and assign wh=
om?"
> 
> LEO made to walk up to TUSCON but SANTON held him back, "You do n=
ot
> have the right to call for my resignation of command, my authority
> e=
xtends from the council." LEO's optics darkened further, "And what
> make's=
 you think I would *ever* sell a life for *anyone* for *any*
> purpose? Tha=
t sounds like a Predacon lie! and you believed it."
> 
> Folding his arms o=
ver his chest LEO glaring at TUSCON, looking and
> obviously feeling very i=
nsulted. "Perhaps it is you who needs to step
> down if you are so easily t=
aken in by this obvious ruse!"
> 
> BREAK and MACH KICK walked over and roo=
ted around the hole that DRILL
> BIT had left behind as if they could pull =
him out of it.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> -Preston
>

of how composed they remained while helping us.  Oh yes I kept that in=

<div><br></div><div>He narrows his eyes with a wise expression.  </div=
><div><br></div><div>" I wondered why the alliance went as well as it did. =
 I was sure to get a refusal but I didn't, and at first I thought noth=
ing of it but then I started thinking.  How could this be?  Oh ye=
s for a grave price you get cooperation from a Predacon.  Now you tell=
 me Leo, I'm listening, how is it that this alliance happened so easily? &n=
bsp;I will take back what I said and things will be as they stand, with you=
 in command of course.  The truth Leo, all I want   IS THE TRUTH.=
  You can tell me that can you?"</div><div><br></div><div>He stands fi=
rm with a thrash of his tail.<br><br>Don't be envious of what you don't hav=

han family and friends.</div><div><br>On Dec 30, 2011, at 5:55 PM, Super Cy=

      <p>> <OLD><br>
><br>
> With g=
reat composure, yet with a serious air to his expression, Tucson<br>
> l=
owers his head to Leo Prime.  Nothing out of his mouth, not even a growl.<b=
r>
> Then he raises his head somewhat with a reserved sigh.<br>
><br>=

> " To assure the alliance, you promised the Predacons a maximal stasis=
 pod.<br>
> Why was this not brought to my attention directly?  And why =
did you agree<br>
> with this bargain without my consent?  I thought I c=
ould trust you, Leo but<br>
> it seems that like Rodimus, that air of tr=
ust simply isn't there.  I'm not<br>
> at all pleased with what has come=
 to my attention, and I demand that the<br>
> bargain be revoked immedia=
tely.  I also demand that you step down from<br>
> command until further=
 notice.  A life is not a mode of currency that can be<br>
> exchanged f=
or cooperation.  We must earn that right with trust and the<br>
> promis=
e to follow through with difficult challenges.   Now as of this<br>
> mo=
ment, I request that Big Convoy assumes command beside me, since he has<br>=

> truly earned my trust during this time.   That's all I have to say, l=
et's<br>
> finish what we started, without having to pay with a life tha=
t is not our<br>
> own."<br>
><br>
> All the while, his tone is ke=
pt soft but with a very heavy heart.  He turns<br>
> away from Leo, with=
 his head lowered in disappointment.<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
LEO PRIM=
E frowned, one that deepened as TUSCON talked.<br>
<br>
There was a frown f=
rom SANTON as well, but he carefully put his arm on<br>
LEO's shoulder as h=
e could see the anger that was building in him as<br>
TUSCON talked.<br>
<b=
r>
In fact there were various blinks and looks of surprise from most of<br>=

the MAXIMALS present. Although PREDACONS like SKY SHADOW got a<br>
mischie=
vous look on his face as he heard the accusation, although<br>
CRYOTEK's wa=
s more amused than anything else.<br>
<br>
"What!?!?" LEO PRIME finally blu=
rted out, his word an explosive sound.<br>
"You relieve me of what and assi=
gn whom?"<br>
<br>
LEO made to walk up to TUSCON but SANTON held him back, =
"You do not<br>
have the right to call for my resignation of command, my au=
thority<br>
extends from the council." LEO's optics darkened further, "And =
what<br>
make's you think I would *ever* sell a life for *anyone* for *any*=
<br>
purpose? That sounds like a Predacon lie! and you believed it."<br>
<b=
r>
Folding his arms over his chest LEO glaring at TUSCON, looking and<br>
o=
bviously feeling very insulted. "Perhaps it is you who needs to step<br>
do=
wn if you are so easily taken in by this obvious ruse!"<br>
<br>
BREAK and =
MACH KICK walked over and rooted around the hole that DRILL<br>
BIT had lef=
t behind as if they could pull him out of it.<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>

-Pres=
ton<br>
